Reviews.Title: “Thank you message”
Reviews.Author: sinwan123
Reviews.Content: Dear Guest, Thank you for choosing Best Western Hotel Causeway Bay for your recent stay and for recommending your experience on TripAdvisor. Thank you for taking the time to post a detailed review of your recent stay. We certainly look forward to welcoming you back and hope to exceed your expectations once again. Sincerely, Doris Chan Executive Assistant Manager

Reviews.Title: “Don't even go in there!”
Reviews.Author: SanjinSonc
Reviews.Content: My clients stayed there for 6 nights, rooms are xtra small, with no closets? and generally very dirty.Hotel smells of sewage, breakfast is terrible and finally - hotel staff is very unpleasant, they don't even call a taxi for their guests. AVOID this hotel, what a shame for Best Western hotel chain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: mycroft47
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for an overnight transit stop, based on the Best Western brand name. Terrible mistake. Difficult to find, even for the taxi driver. Prostitutes coming and going as I checked in. Tiny room, not very clean. Best Western should seriously reconsider associating their name with this terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, if you can avoid an inflated price.”
Reviews.Author: erable
Reviews.Content: It’s a shame that hotels do the “greedy grab” when an event (like a rugby match) means that nearly all rooms are only available at a premium. In keeping with this charming practice, the Causeway Bay Best Western asked us double the price for a second day’s stay in our boutique “mini-room.” We declined. I won’t overstate what has already been said about this hotel: small room (where my large feet seemed to smash into every angle it offered), small bathroom, uncomfortable beds and a noisy hall (before I dispatched them, some charming guests were acting out a threesome on the carpet near our door.) Although front desk staff seemed indifferent to our arrival (and likewise our departure), I did find café staff and bellhops (does one say that now?) very friendly. The buffet breakfast was a great deal, and the manager of the café was very attentive, and kept me awash in coffee. Similarly, the staff who checked our luggage were extremely helpful, and we left our bags to stroll the city, knowing that they were in good hands. The location was great, and I didn’t find the streets dodgy. Would I return? Possibly, if no events were in town to tip the scales toward a much higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: inxpekto
Reviews.Content: While some people complaints about the sketchy streets location and small rooms, I do think some premium hotels in NYC Times Square or in certain parts of Bangkok also on 'sketchy street' location. I do feel safe walking around, even coming back to the hotel at 2am. The securiy guard is forever with people manning the property, that's a big plus point. Room is small, no doubt, but it is sufficient to place even my 32 kg business class suit case on the other bed. No closet space if my memory serves me right. I was allocated a high floor corner room with a spectacular of Race Course and the city.The bed is comfortable just like any Best Western hotel brand, shower head is powerful. I do think having a bath mat would be great. Internet speed is good and additional bottled water and ironing board and transformer were delivered prompty even at 10pm. The down size is that it has no porter service. Life is small but it serves its function. Service is good. Staff explains everything in great details in their best capacity. I highly recommend this hotel for those passengers on transit, solo travel with a budget in mind, and want to experience the spectacular view of other premium hotels without burning your pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a small room”
Reviews.Author: Check R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Times Square, only 5 minutes walk. It is quite easy to commute, comparing to the other hotels I stayed in HK. Nevertheless, the subway station at Times Square is huge. It would take awhile to walk from the subway to the hotel. The room was very small and the bed is not very comfortable. There were plenty of food around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,Cheap and Super Small”
Reviews.Author: Optimus101
Reviews.Content: Cheap in term of price as it is so near to Causeway Bay and Lee Garden. Room is super small. Service is SOSO.. A better than Budget Hotel Option

Reviews.Title: “Delivers, if you don't mind small space and sketchy backstreets”
Reviews.Author: Lane C
Reviews.Content: I stayed some five nights at this hotel. If you need a place to crash in Causeway Bay, it's OK. - The room was small even by HK standards. - I couldn't open the window, but that might be my fault. - Broadband speed is decent, around 20Mb. - Staff is helpful. - It's located in a sketchy backstreet that's sort of a market and smells pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “hilarious - but budget”
Reviews.Author: tripfi
Reviews.Content: stayed here as a friend booked it as the last cheap accom during the weekend of hong kong 7s.... don't know how she managed 5 nights here - i only had 2. greeted by 'ladies of the night' in the lobby, but the staff were genuine in providing good service. the shelves on the wall (only storage) broke off the wall but were fixed the next day. wash basin behind the door. staff couldn't hail me a cab with my suitcase as there's no traffic on that street so i had to walk to the next hotel in the heat. cab driver couldn't find the hotel either - it's not that well known it seems. fine if you are travelling on your own and are not going to be there much except to sleep - but any longer and the lack of space will drive you mad.

Reviews.Title: “Oh well - I knew hotel rooms in HK are small but THAT small?”
Reviews.Author: WorldWondererNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location, though in the middle of a so-called "wet market" which may not be everyone's first choice. Subway is close by. I got a micro-room on the 11th or so floor, which was so small that not even the suitcase fitted anywhere in opened state. I had to put it on the extra bed. NO CLOSET, but a nice shower. I stayed in a few hotels in HK before, but this room was by far the smallest, and it was not even that cheap. Staff was very friendly and housekeeping good.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, bad staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bleehk
Reviews.Content: To be honest i booked this very quickly and didnt pay attention to the reviews on here... Worst place i have stayed ever. Rooms are tiny, no cupboards, no space move, really bad bathroom, the sink is behind the front door! I paid peak time rates for a box room, Staff dont really care, if you ask a question its like they are doing you a favour in replying... the guys in the lobby (which is not really a lobby) wont even help fiind a taxi as the hotel in on a back road where no taxis go. The only good thing about this is the view.. Conclusion, dont go to this hotel, overpriced, over rated . Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “WAY TOO SMALL ROOMS !!”
Reviews.Author: OzJamesBeijing
Reviews.Content: Thought we would be getting something nice when we booked and found the confirmation stated "upgrade to Superior Room" -- wow -- there was literally NOwhere to put and open a suitcase - just a very narrow space around the bed -- NO wardrobe, just an opening in the wall with two hangers in it and not much room for anything else -- no chair, no desk or working space, just a fold up 30cm x 60cm shelf attached to the wall beside the bed. No reading lights at the bed, the overhead chandelier (!) was about 5 candlepower. Just as well the TV was LCD flat screen on the wall - if it was "old" technology it would have been a huge obstacle. Bathroom tiny - a 2'6" (75cm) square floor space to stand in, with toilet immediately at the left, shower straight ahead and hand basin on the right. Tiniest room I ever had after 30+ visits to Hong Kong. Weird and unconventional entrance and lobby arrangement, and badly signed. Only things going for it were location close to Causeway Bay/Times Square (though tucked away in a grubby back street) and reasonable cleanliness. My wife and I will definitely NOT be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dong bring a suitcase”
Reviews.Author: NealeB
Reviews.Content: Because there is nowhere to put it. The rooms are so small I wouldn't bring a wife either. To be fair they are clean, but the beds are not good. Good locaction tho. The jacuzzi is cold water, be careful but in a great position for a sunny day up on 39th floor with a glass screen.

Reviews.Title: “SMAAAL ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: SAMEER1981
Reviews.Content: the rooms are so small....tooo bad to be real...never check in with family in this hotel or you will be squeezed....rally small bathrooms...no almirahs or wardrobes in room even the wash basin out side the washroom...

Reviews.Title: “Small yet cosy”
Reviews.Author: JermaeTan
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is awesome. 5 to 6 mins walk to Causeway Bay Station. Surrounded with quite a lot of eateries (茶餐廳). Downside is that the hotel might not be easily spotted if you have not been around this part of Causeway Bay. Simple way to identity: once come out from Exit A of Causeway Bay, walk directly across to the other end of Times Square. You should be passing by Levi's and Rolex shop which will be on your right. Go under the flyover and you'll see More & More Cafeteria (多多餐廳). Turn left and walk all the way down to the end. You will pass by DCH Foods and some shops selling Chinese praying stuff (joss sticks, statues of Buddha & etc). There you will see a sign that will direct you to Best Western hotel. Stayed at guest room #2102. There is a cafe located at Level 6 but I didn't get to try coz good food is everywhere in Hong Kong. Also I saw on their hotel info TV channel that they have a Jacuzzi at the top floor but then again I didn't try as 1) didn't bring any swimming costume, 2) it was raining on Day 3 & 4 of my trip. Toilet amenities - Basic supplies. But maybe 1 thing to suggest to the hotel: to install toilet roll holder in the guest room toilet. Toilet paper was left at the shelf under the basin and I have to reach to get it. It was not a far reach but then again I don't think anyone would like the idea of having toilet paper left on the shelf. Room size is just nice for a single traveler. If family size wise, I guess they do have bigger rooms accommodated to that. Housekeeping attendant is friendly and she did a great job for the room. Laundry service - Available in hotel but I didn't use. Just outside the hotel there's a couple laundry shops and its all within the same block of the hotel or near. Guess I'm a happy girl with no complaints. Definitely recommended to couples and singles.

Reviews.Title: “Near MTR....”
Reviews.Author: MVH1951
Reviews.Content: Towering hotel in good location, set near the "wet market" or fish market. Steps from Causeway Bay MTR station and Times Square. Rooms are small, bathroom tiny. Sometimes even the cab drivers have trouble finding the front door.

Reviews.Title: “A little better than your avg China hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelwiz27
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location. You could hop on the trolley right outside the doors of the hotel. The room was spacious, although a little awkwardly narrow. Our room had a seperate sitting area from the bedroom. The beds were very firm- typical for Chinese hotels but still not my comfort preference. Very clean room and hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and tiny”
Reviews.Author: TravelExploreTaste
Reviews.Content: It was chilly in Hong Kong and the hotel has no heat. The tiny room was clean but I couldn't enjoy it at all because I was shivering the whole time. If I had taken my suitcase to the room there would have been no place to open it because the room is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Causeway Bay for Filipinos”
Reviews.Author: tripadvise888marie
Reviews.Content: Our family goes to hong kong every year to bond and relax. I have three grown up boys now and they usually buy their stuff in Hong Kong, It is our first time to stay in Causeway Bay and it is not advisable for us. First, the hotels are small and very expensive. Would u believe exchange rate is only 7 to 7.10 per dollar when u can change to 7.7 normally. My boys favorite place in Causeway Bay were Times Square and the World Trade Center since they love japanese jeans (EVISU) stuffs and shirts at UNIQLO. We discovered these brands in Osaka and since then, they loved it. SPARTA jeans is a Hong Kong brand but very japanese and cool.For shoes it is still to buy original at Mongkok and electronics at Sam Shui po for a bargain. For resetting of jewelries its still Larrys at Nathan Road or Anita Chan.

Reviews.Title: “Very small, expensive, but good location”
Reviews.Author: DotyIsrael
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel, the personnel are polite and helpful, the rooms are too tiny for the relatively high price I paid. The location is very good if you really want to absorb the Chineese aspect of HK.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: TriosSHCC
Reviews.Content: The good: convenient location, near Times Square and the subway line; room rate was good because we got the promotion price; our room had a good view on the hill side and the Happy Valley horse tracks. The bad: room is terribly small: no drawer or closet or a chair, not even a wall-mounted rack of hooks. So what do you do with your coat/jacket in winter days, let alone the clothings you are in that day and those you want to wear the next day? no space for opening even a small sized suitcase. The only desk top space is that extended from the windowsill, on which are two drinking glasses, a teapot and some instant coffee/teabags. no bedside lamp, making it impossible to read a book or consult the map of Hong Kong. The ugly: During the two days of our stay, early in the morning we heard some "strange music" through the broadcasting system, not sure if it was music, or prayers, but why and what for?? morning call??

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, front desk not upto the mark”
Reviews.Author: RiteshAgarwal
Reviews.Content: Had a rally bad experience there. We were there on our honeymoon and were shocked to find a room with 2 single beds whereas we had booked a queen size bedroom. On request to the front desk to change the room, we were told that no rooms are vacant. We had done our booking few months in advance and were shocked to hear this. When we requested to meet the manager to put in a formal complaint, suddenly the front desk gave us the double bedroom! Room was very small, one could barely walk. Seems everything was just fitted somehow. The only silver lining was that the concierge was very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, HK Stile rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andreas S
Reviews.Content: Booked through booking.com the lowest room cat. but stll 80Euro and last nite I(of 3) 120Euro. Location in a small sideline beside freshmarket, small vendors 5 min walk to Times Square etc. Friendly staff. Lobby is located at 3rd floor and rooms from floor 4 to 37. Stayed in the Run of house version, luckily 33rd floor and view to the hills of HK Island. Twinroom, quit small. As I used it as single room I could place my stuff. No sidebord or cabinet !!!! The sink was in the small corridor and toilet and shower was behind a slide door with exhauster. Ameneties have been ok. Tea-/Coffeemaking facillities provided. At the top ( 39 F) is a small plunge pool located with deck chairs as well as a little spa.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Makar126
Reviews.Content: Extremely small rooms - don't open your suitcase, otherwise you won't be able to move in a room. And that is at US$200 per night without breakfast! Very strange light - there's no small lamp close to the bed, only upper lights - so you can't make comfortable atmosphere. Room furniture and bath looked old. Check-in is only from 14:00, so there's no chance to get a room if you're arriving early in the morning and you'd have to wait. Shall I come again? - No.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: mommy_tere
Reviews.Content: We were given smoking rooms when we specifically said upon booking that we wanted to stay in a non-smoking floor. Ok, so we couldn't wait anymore for a non-smoking room (it was already past noon) so we did take the room on the smoking floor. The smell was not so bad so we thought we will survive. The room was tiny. If you have a big suitcase, like us, there's nowhere to put it except on the floor outside the bathroom but then you won't be able to open the room door. There's no closet or drawers so leave the clothes in the suitcase and leave it upright until you're sure you won't go out anymore then and only then you should open the suitcase as it will also serve as your closet/ drawers. Room was clean when we checked in. Signs of wear and tear. Walls should be cleaned!!! But it's fine if you're just there to sleep. Not enough light in the room. Seriously, you won't be able to read a book. The ref's tiny. Hahaha. Like a toy. See photo :) The bed's too soft. But it's ok for a couple of night's sleep. Only 2 people in a room. I don't know how three will fit. The bathroom's newly renovated. So that's good. No tub. Tiny. BUT CLEAN. Really clean. Concierge was terrible. Left our luggage upon check-out (it was too early to go to the airport). Came back to put our "shopping loot" in the luggages so I opened the suitcases in the concierge area (not even the hotel lobby as that was in the 3rd floor) and the guy said NO because the food I was holding will smell (it was bbq pork, duh). So he told me to do it outside. I had to leave the hotel, go to the sidewalk and do the packing there. Didn't even call a taxi for us. Hmph. Location is so-so. You have to cross main road to go to Times Square then walk a couple of streets down to the heart of Causeway. Won't stay here again. Won't recommend it either. Unless, like me, you're booking last minute and this is the only affordable option.

Reviews.Title: “Weird spot for hotel but extremely good location”
Reviews.Author: mikmakAja
Reviews.Content: Was really shocked the first time we arrived at the hotel and figure out it was located in an alley with dumspter in front of the hotel. Not to mention that the room was the smallest room i ever stay..but i guess land price is expensive andthey must make the most out of the space. However, turns out the location is vv good. Closeby to times square mall, little shops, mtr station, restaurants ranging from dirt cheap to expensive ones, so we dont use any taxi at all going while we're in hk. Value for money i guess..as long as you can pass the room size fact!

Reviews.Title: “small hotel but good service”
Reviews.Author: IonaL968
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel to me. Room is small, with 2 twin size beds and you cannot walk. Once you step out of the elevator, you reach your room just 1 step or 2. Location is good though, close to Times Square and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. Service is good. Overall, it's a pleasant stay if you don't mind living in a small room.

Reviews.Title: “BAD STAY”
Reviews.Author: lrother
Reviews.Content: Came with boyfriend for 3 nights. Rooms were horribly small, first room I couldnt accept. I have been in countless hotels in HK and have never seen anything so small. Shower is barely a shower, almost same as bathroom. Walls are filthy. Decor is really tacky, trying to be nice. PRO'S: Location is good as right in Causeway Bay. Staff is nice. Internet is fast. Only way to stay here is if you are travelling solo and spending ZERO time in room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a hotel in Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: Rita W
Reviews.Content: I would have to let you know that the shower in the best western in Hong Kong had the shortest tub I have seen. Also the shower head was a little short, my boyfriend to duck his head to use the shower, and there is actually a window between the shower and the room..so please ask about this if you are not staying as a couple because it might be awkward. The entrance is a little hard to find, as the entrance is kind of in an alleyway. However, just a couple steps outside you will see that there is an outdoor market right there! The hotel is in a pretty good location, about a five minute walk to the MTR and there are tons of restaurants and shops around. I would say that the price is decent for Hong Kong Island. The room is clean and while it is small, it has about everything you would need. Hey you are on Hong Kong island, hopefully if you are there, you are not spending a ton of time in your hotel except for sleeping purposes!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelkid88
Reviews.Content: One of the best bed ever slept in Hongkong, thou rather small (twin size bed) but fit the purpose for a good nite sleep. Room is small, very small to the extend it is just like the size of your third bedroom plus a toilet (no longbath only standing shower). Entrance is thru a backlane and check in on the 3rd floor (don worry as there is a Porter on the ground floor to guide you up). Location was superb and for those looking for cheap mean of transport, jump on the tramp which is 200m away and if heading to Kowloon, jump off the tramp at Wanchai ferry terminal and catch a Star ferry to Kowloon (Service cease at midnite or when typhoon signal 8 is declared) The only drawback is we check in very late at 9.30pm and our request for 1pm checkout the followind day was turned down by a squating lady supervisor!! She dare not stand to answer us and just shook her head ignoring our plight. No name mention but her hair is short. Overall will suggest you stay there for a sleep and don expect anything else...

Reviews.Title: “great staff clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ilonafox
Reviews.Content: I have been last week in Hong Kong and we stay in Best Western Hotel and we are happy.The room was small but i didnt go there to seat in hotel ,few hours sleep that was enough .To beautiful city to spend a lot of time in hotel.Anyway Hotel was clean and nice looking inside Best Western Hotel have so nice staff ,cultivated ,friendship,helpful ,lovely people!!!Very good service! Very good location as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “their STAFF NEEDS MORE TRAINING!!”
Reviews.Author: m k
Reviews.Content: I specifically requested for NON SMOKING room at the counter when checking in for more than 3 times.however, this lady STILL put me on a SMOKING floor! the room was stinky, the beds are not even completely done with pillows piling on 1 bed. I felt like they FORGOT to arrange it. what's more to come was when I got down and lined up to ask for a room change, one of the front desk lady saw me and whispered to the one who checked-in for me in Cantonese "she must be here to ask for a room change" while GIGGLING. then I said to her in Cantonese "ya, you must know what i'm here for, huh?" she was really surprised and said "wah..she knows how to speak chinese..." can you believe this kind of service offered by an international hotel???? then another lady stepped in asked me what the problem is, i told her I specifically REQUESTED for NON SMOKING room but they still put me on SMOKING FLOOR?? yes, she finally changed my room to a so called non smoking floor; which the room still stinks! I would NOT STAY at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and remarkably quiet, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: tourismplanner
Reviews.Content: The Best Western is a new addition to HK's budget inventory. It is excellent value and although the rooms are small they are well appointed and well equipped. Unlike may of its competitiors it has a wide range of satellite TV channels and excellent high speed wireless internet. In spite of being in busy Causeway Bay the hotel is located in a quiet side street and has great views over the city. Go for a high floor 30F + for the best views and a quiet restful nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: kratky
Reviews.Content: We booked a wheelchair-accessible room, but what we got was a joke. There was no more space in the room than to fit a small queen bed. I kid you not. There could've been perhaps 1.5 ft of space on one side of the bed when we pushed it all the way to the wall. There was no way for a wheelchair user to fit beside the bed. No way to reach the coffee service (stuck in a tiny nook underneath the window beyond the bed). No way to turn around. True, the bathroom was quite spacious - in fact, it was probably larger in area than the rest of the cubicle. When we asked for a larger room, we were told there were none (as in none existed - ours was supposed to be the largest room in the hotel). Considering the fact that the price wasn't exactly low, I was very disappointed. The hotel will do well for an able-bodied person, but don't expect to hang out in the room. Also, the bathroom may've been large, but the plumbing was awful. Badly done, dirty and it actually got in the way when you wanted to use the (miniscule) wash basin. The rooms have air-con, but the hallways do not. Wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: flapflap
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on a Thursday night to begin our 3 night stay. We were allocated a twin-bed room because all the double-bed rooms were full, although the staff did promise that we would be able to swap into a double-bed room for the following 2 nights. There was a distinctive stale cigarette smell on entering the small room, and a used tissue left on the floor (albeit just under one of the beds, only discovered because we pushed the twin beds together). Moved to a double-bed room as promised the next night which also smelt of stale cigarette smoke (this is only remarkable because both of the floors we stayed on were both meant to be non-smoking). Overall impression was average, but given we chose this hotel over others we've stayed at in Hong Kong (Ibis North Point and Harbourview Hong Kong) because it was cheaper, I think we got what we paid for. Other points of interest: The decor reminded us of a karaoke bar (faux chandeliers, black tiled walls and a gilded frame around the LCD TV); The ground floor entrance is effectively through a driveway - you have to go up a couple of floors in the lift to get to the actual lobby; The room size is pretty much equivalent to those in Ibis North Point but Best Western does have the advantage of having 3 lifts rather than only 1 and a more convenient location for shopping and eating in Causeway Bay compared to North Point; The surrounding markets are great if you're into that sort of thing but be prepared to walk through crowds and dubious puddles to get to Times Square and Causeway Bay shopping; There's free wireless internet (ask at reception for the password); and There are 2 laundries conveniently located around the corner, one being a 24 hour self-service.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: dgirl72712
Reviews.Content: The young man at check in was very pleasant but the upgrade we were promised during our email reservation process never happened. The room was a tiny 8X8 box. Moderately clean and certainly functional but not the best value for the cost. Easy walk to Times Square but still in an awkward location. We avoided the restaurant/lounge - seemed sketchy. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: American-liv-n-China
Reviews.Content: It's Hong Kong so expect small rooms unless you stay far from the action or you have a lot of money to burn. This hotel was nice and clean. The room was small but enough for 1-2 people who want to get out and paint the city red. There isn't much for lounging around but if you don't mind just laying on the bed and working or watching a movie then it's a good hotel. The location is good near the MTR and Time Square. If you need a family room, this is not the hotel for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Best Western Hotel Causeway Bay
HotelInfo.Address: No.38 Bowrington Road, Hong Kong, China
